column4: I just got an inspiron 6400 and I tried installing ubuntu on it and i was sad to find out that gdm doesnt work on it.
and I just installed ubuntu and didnt change any of the default settings
I was also trying to find out if anyone knows if the dell truemobile card was supported?
well when it starts up it tells me that GDM is disabled.. I'm a linux system administrator who has never used Linux as a desktop before.. so its kind of a funny paradigm...
I guess I could get by just using it in the shell.
but then I may as well just use windows.
doesnt even mention this one lol
guess windows it is :-)
Intel
what exact error was that with gdm again?
don't paste it here :)
np, just being sure :)
Does your xorg.conf mention PCI: (0:2:1) ? the log mentions 0:2:0 as well
lspci
pop that new xorg.conf up on a pastebin
the log was
I get the wrong page with xorg.conf
oh sorry, try now.
ok, I'm paddling over my head here, I would expect 0:2:1 to be ignored, since it's not mentioned in the xorg.conf
if it said that, think I'd try that as my pci device in xorg.conf
